featured.text: Researchers in this study worked with 10 volunteers, ages 24 to 46.
Some have many small private shops, while others have organizations steered by volunteers.
Run by a team of church volunteers, the shop will collect any surplus, good-quality items and store them until they can be redistributed to the people who are needing those particular things.

other.text: How did the volunteers learn to expect different levels of heat?
Each volunteer wore a device that gave out 20-second-long pulses of heat to the right leg.
The researchers found that the parts of the brain involved in learning, memory, emotion, and touch became more active as the volunteers expected higher levels of pain.
During training, the volunteers would first hear a tone, followed by a period of silence, and then feel a heat pulse.
The pulses were given to the arms of the volunteers.

to help those who could not afford certain household items (B) to open a furniture store run by church volunteers (C) to teach people how to destroy disposable furniture (D) to sell good-quality furniture to disabled people 43.
Interestingly, when the volunteers expected only mild or moderate pain but experienced severe pain, they reported feeling 28 percent less pain than when they expected severe pain and actually got it.

definition.zh_def: 志願者；自願提供服務或幫助的人。
definition.en_def: A person who freely offers to take part in an activity or provide a service without being paid.
definition.example: She decided to volunteer at the local animal shelter on weekends.
